page.title: 10LOCAL NEWS
page.content: Camphill High School has just scooped 1st prize in a top competition. Pupils in the schools Home Economics Department have won Â£300 worth of electrical equipment and the three team members have each recieved a portable T.V. set. The competition run by the South of Scotland Electricity Board, challenged youngsters from all over Scotland to prepare a 3 course dinner for under Â£6 a head. Their winning menu is Portree Plums, Tiree Trout (includng 2 tablespoons of whisky and minted Tannahill, the ingredients of which are cooking apples, honey, mint sprigs and egg white). The main judge was Mr. Alex Dickie, head of catering at Reid Kerr College Paisley and the final staged in Motherwell, was hosted by BBC Scotland's Viv Lumsden.
